context.p: To collapse elements manually, do the following:

step.info: To collapse a single element, do the following:

substep.cmd: Place the cursor in the element in the Editing Window or click the element in the ContentMap.

fig.title: The section element to be collapsed.

substep.cmd: Choose View Collapse Element , or press Ctrl-.

note.p: If there is a Folding List for your document, collapsing will collapse not the current element but the closest parent element that is mentioned on the list. Suppose you frequently collapse chapters and sections, but never paras. If you want to quickly collapse the current section without moving the cursor from the current para, you can narrow the list of collapsible elements. For details, see the folding-list element in .

step.info: To collapse several elements, do the following:

substep.cmd: Select the elements in the Editing Window or in the ContentMap.
Choose View Collapse Element , or press Ctrl-., or right-click the selection and select Collapse Element from the context menu.

step.info: To collapse an ancestor of an element, do the following:

substep.cmd: Place the cursor in the element in the Editing Window or click the element in the ContentMap.
Choose View Collapse <ANCESTOR_NAME> , or right-click the element and select Collapse <ANCESTOR_NAME> from the context menu.
